issue.title: non-const basic_string::data should not invalidate iterators

discussion.p: /4 does not list non-const basic_string::data() as being a function that may be called with the guarantee that it will not invalidate references, pointers, and iterators to elements of a basic_string object.
Wed PM: Move to Tentatively Ready

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4606.

blockquote.p: -4- References, pointers, and iterators referring to the elements of a basic_string sequence may be invalidated by the following uses of that basic_string object:

li.p: as an argument to any standard library function taking a reference to non-const basic_string as an argument.(footnote 230)
Calling non-const member functions, except operator[], at, data, front, back, begin, rbegin, end, and rend.
